reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Sat night for our anniversary in a room with a whirlpool. It was fabulous! They even let us check in early. The room with the extra kitchen area/whirlpool was clean and had plenty of space. The whole suite was pretty well maintained.
reviews.title: great clean room, friendly staff, great breakfast, relaxing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening when we returned to the lobby there were otis spumkmyer cookies for the guests set out in little bags! They hit the spot and were delicious! We stayed on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet even though there was a boys baseball team staying there.
reviews.title: Stopped on our way to PA; comfortable, clean and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast they serve in the morning was the best continental breakfast I've ever seen at a hotel. They had so many items and plenty of food . They even had hot items(eggs, french toast sticks and waffles). The only negative is that they are a little more pricey than other hotels in the areas. The tax on the room was almost 18%.
reviews.title: The staff is amazingly kind!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, it's worth it to stay in a clean decent hotel.
reviews.title: Very good option in Flemington

reviews.text: This hotel is on a highway in Flemington, close to chain stores and other big roads - not the place to go for scenic views. But it was easily found - even in a snowstorm - and we got just the room we wanted. The bed was comfortable; everything was clean and in good repair. Hampton Inn's comfy pillows and comforters were there, and the free Internet and nice TV were all in place. The continental breakfast also included a pre-made egg omelet, a nice touch! There was good tea, too. If that won't do it for you, there's an in-hotel entrance to the Perkins Pancake House on the property, although we didn't go there. When we arrived looking for a place for dinner, the desk clerk gave us directions to a good pub up the highway. It was a nice stay.
reviews.title: Not as nice as prior stays but okay

reviews.text: Some of the best staff at Hampton I have seen. Conveniently connected to a Perkins. Good size pool area. Breakfast area is well maintained. Have stayed here several times, good experience each time.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great Hampton.

reviews.text: Great staff. So good, i'll mention it twice. Nice cookies at check in as well.
reviews.title: Terrific service but dated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here a couple of times for business and I am pleased to say the attentive staff far outshine the dated accommodations. The coffee is good and the morning breakfast crew supply everything you could want and more and it's all fresh. The pool is kept clean and the exercise room is adequate for a one night stay
reviews.title: Quantity, Quantity, Quiet...

reviews.text: I always wanted to try a Hampton Inn (I think because years ago they were the only chain with a hot breakfast) and just never got the chance until now, usually staying at Holiday inn Express, Comfort inns, etc. I've no complaints about them, but I will say that if all Hamptons are run as this one is, I would pay more to stay at a Hampton (as long as I don't have my dog with me, as they don't allow pets)..
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and orderly, and it has all the usual amenities one expects from a hotel of this class: indoor pool, whirlpool, small fitness room, HD plasma tvs,the full hot complimentary breakfast, meeting rooms, fresh baked cookies, small boxes of mints at the desk, hairdryer, coffee maker, iron, newspaper..,wifi.... What seemed to set it apart is the service., From the moment we walked in, we were special. The woman who checked me in called me a few moments later to ask if the room was satisfactory. Rob, her partner behind the desk, was evidently matching her act for act in the service derby. Finding that there was no tea with the coffeemaker (an unsettling occurrence which has happened often since the fall - the last two times in large hotels, one in which we were simply told there was no tea and the second in which we were exhorted to get it from room service, for about $10.00 of course - plus delivery charge, tax and gratuity) I went to the desk and asked if there were a couple of tea bags I could have. Rob asked what kind I wanted and, when he turned to get it, was approached by a group of women from one of the meeting rooms who were trying to tip him for being so helpful. He was trying to explain to them that he couldn't accept tips and in that second, the woman from the desk came back and asked what I needed. I told her that he was getting me some tea and was just briefly interrupted. She demanded to be the one to get me the tea, took me to the breakfast area and showed me where I could get all the tea, in all the flavors, I could possibly want. after grabbing a couple of bags and thanking her I turned to go but Rob, now free, asked where I'd gone. I told him the tea situation was taken care of by his cohort but he insisted on helping even more. "I am going to set you up. I take care of my guests," he said. I told him that I had the two bags and that was fine, but he took me to the kitchen, where he had me pick out more teas. Needless to say I was in tea heaven. I haven,t had service like this since at a Fairmont hotel. In how many hotels do desk staff practically trip over each other trying to help you? I chatted with this pair later on and they are really two very nice, very helpful people who take pride in what they do. They made the stay, rather than simply very good, extraordinary. I realize this a long review but it seems that it illustrates how great the staff is better than I could do otherwise. I was very impressed.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for my son's wedding and it was a big group of people staying there. Our rooms were clean and and it had a decent size bathroom. Some people staying in the third floor did complain that their non-smoking rooms smelled like smoke. Ours was in the first floor and it was fine. My mother-in-law needed a meeting room to arrange the table flower arrangements and the bouquets for the bride and bridesmaids and they were very accommodating and helpful in bringing her tables, chairs, buckets, and everything else she needed. I don't eat much for breakfast but it looked good. Coffee and juice was available 24/7 at the eating area. It has a restaurant right next to it for those who didn't want to wonder around town for a heartier breakfast or any other meal.
reviews.title: Very accomodating

reviews.text: We got a group rate which I think it was reasonable $118/night. Overall a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: 1 BR suite is one big room, with open plan bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a 1 BR suite for 3 occupants through the web site. Naturally, based on the web description, I expected a bedroom, a living room with a sleeper sofa and a bathroom. No such room exists there. This was the second Hampton Inn to unpleasantly surprise me on this road trip. The premium priced room they gave us had a single room with an integrated open plan jacuzzi bath (no door). There wasn't even a place for our daughter to sleep. Fortunately they weren't full and we switched to a room with twin queen beds and a bathroom door. Had they told me the room they sold me didn't exist, I would have booked elsewhere. The email confirmation clearly states 3 people 1 BR Suite. What's so difficult?
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for only one night while passing through town. Felt it was slightly overpriced but I was satisfied with the hotel and room and nothing comes cheap anymore. While not fancy, the room was a decent size and was very clean. I am very particular about cleanliness of rooms... particularly the bathroom which again, was very clean. The decor was well done in the lobby and halls as well. Would stay again and would recommend. They offer a breakfast however, we ate next door at Perkins and they also have a pool.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a week-end at this hotel while visiting NewHope, and was pleasantly surprise with the accommodations. We were attracted by the $129.00 nightly rate which was actually for a king-sized handicap room. We accepted the option of upgrading to a regular King-sized room for three dollars more per night. The advertised fridge and microwave were not available and was only made available for the more pricier rooms, but the free internet was a plus. With taxes the the total rate was $151.50 per night. However, the room and bathroom were very clean, the bed was pleasantly comfortable and the staff extremely helpful, pleasant and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast included eggs with breakfast meat, potatoes, etc. and Perkins Pancake house was attached for all meals as well. Beverages including fresh coffee was made available throughout the day with gourmet cookies set out in the evenings. If you're looking for scenery this is not the place because it's tucked away in an industrial way near a main corridor with nothing pleasant to view from your room window. Perhaps if they had a open patio and/or a bar for hotel customers it would be more inclusive and entertaining. Overall we very happy with our first Hampton Inn visit.
reviews.title: So much for 100% satisfaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This part of New Jersey (and adjacent Pennsylvania) have plenty of B&Bs, inns, lodges, auberges, etc for when you're in a mood for quaint, cute, historic, cozy or antique accommodations, but not so many motels and hotels that offer plain, modern rooms with all the "mod cons". The Hamton Inn Flemington, NJ is one that offers all the amenities we've come to expect in a mid-range chain properties, and like most Hampton Inns it does it well. Our king-bedded room was excellently cleaned and maintained. The property has only one elevator, but, despite the fact the hotel was hosting guests at a wedding, there was little waiting for it.
reviews.title: A Good Modern Hotel in the Land of B&Bs

reviews.text: In a slight variation of the theme, it shares a building with a Perkins (chain) Restaurant, so lunches and dinners are available with going outside; we didn't eat there, but can picture being happy to have it available in inclement weather. Hampton Inn's own breakfast is standard for this chain; the breakfast buffet was stocked, cleaned and replenished, and the tables cleared, particularly promptly. (The scrambled eggs, though, were just as mediocre as is typical for this chain and its main competitors.)
reviews.title: Very good shape - bad Internet connection.

reviews.text: All staff were very pleasant and helpful, including front desk, breakfast room attendant, house man, and housekeepers.
reviews.title: It meets the need

reviews.text: In-room broadband is by Wi-Fi or, on request, via a wired form I hadn't used before The desk supplies a unit which is attached to your computer's ethernet jack; the other end plugs into the room's 110 volt AC outlet, apparently sending the signal through that wiring. I found this slightly frightening, but it worked and my computer seems no worse for the experience. However, while this system is probably more secure than WiFi, it seemed, if anything, slightly slower. (The WiFi worked well.)
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.text: This was a good example of a Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: My Maid was a Thief...enough said.
